name: Freeze Tag
description: Two players start a scene. At any time, a player on the sidelines can yell 'Freeze!', tag one player out, take their position, and start a new scene.

name: One Word Story
description: Players tell a story one word at a time, taking turns in a circle.

name: Park Bench
description: One player sits on a park bench. Other players join and try to make the first player leave, without touching them or directly telling them to go.

name: Yes, And...
description: Two players have a conversation where they must always start their sentence with 'Yes, and...', building on what the other person has said.

name: Alphabet Game
description: Two players have a conversation where each sentence must start with the next letter of the alphabet.

name: Party Quirks
description: One player hosts a party. The other players are given quirks by the audience, and the host must guess what they are.

name: Change
description: Two players start a scene. At any point, the director can yell 'Change!', at which point the last player to speak must change what they said.

name: Sound Ball
description: Players pass around an imaginary 'sound ball', mimicking and evolving the sound as they 'throw' and 'catch' it.

name: Emotional Symphony
description: Players stand in a semicircle. One player conducts, pointing to different players to 'play' their assigned 'emotion'.

name: What Are You Doing?
description: Players alternate asking 'What are you doing?' and responding with an action that's unrelated to their current activity, which the asker then performs.

name: Blind Line
description: Players perform a scene while periodically pulling lines of dialogue written by the audience out of a hat and incorporating them into the scene.

name: Half Life
description: A scene is played in one minute, then replayed in 30 seconds, 15 seconds, and so on, each time keeping the essence of the scene while speeding it up.

name: Entrances and Exits
description: Each player is assigned a word. Whenever that word is said in the scene, they must enter or exit.

name: New Choice
description: Players perform a scene. A director can yell 'new choice' at any time, causing the player to change their last line of dialogue.

name: Conducted Story
description: Players stand in a line. One person conducts, pointing to different players to continue the story.

name: Columns
description: Two players perform a scene with two audience members standing in as 'columns'. When a player taps a 'column', they must immediately provide a word or phrase, which the player must justify.

name: Zip Zap Zop
description: Players stand in a circle and pass the 'energy' with the phrases 'Zip', 'Zap', and 'Zop'. The game is about keeping the rhythm and focus.

name: Beastie Rap
description: Players stand in a circle and do a rhyming call-and-response rap about a suggested beastie, like 'Dinosaur'/'Hit the floor'.

name: Late for Work
description: One player is 'late for work' and has to guess three reasons why, acted out by three other players and guided by the 'boss' player.

name: Object Tag
description: Players interact with an imaginary object, passing it and transforming it as it goes.

name: Day in the Life
description: One player tells the story of their day, and then other players reenact it with embellishments and exaggerations.

name: Questions Only
description: Players can only speak in questions. If they make a statement, they are swapped out with another player.

name: 3 Line Scenes
description: In groups of three, players act out short three-line scenes. Each line should establish character, relationship, and setting.

name: Sit, Stand, Bend
description: Three players perform a scene. At any time, one must be sitting, one standing, and one bending. If a player changes position, the others must adjust to keep the balance.

name: Gibberish Translator
description: Two players act out a scene in gibberish, with a third translating. The gibberish-speaking players must convey the scene through physicality and inflection.

name: Mirroring
description: Pairs stand facing each other and try to mirror each other's movements as closely as possible, fostering a connection.

name: Soundscape
description: Players close their eyes and create a soundscape of a certain location or theme, like 'jungle' or 'spooky castle'.

name: Revolver
description: Four scenes are performed by pairs of players. After each round, the 'revolver' rotates and the next scene begins.

name: Dubbing
description: Two players perform a silent scene while two other players provide their dialogue.

name: The Orchestra
description: Each player picks an instrument (real or imaginary) and plays it. One person conducts, creating a musical 'narrative'.

name: World's Worst
description: Players line up and step forward one by one to act out the 'world's worst' example of a given profession or situation.

name: Pass the Face
description: One player makes a face, then 'passes' it to the next player by making eye contact. That player must mimic the face and pass it along.

name: Slow Motion Samurai
description: Players take turns to be the Samurai who, in slow motion, 'attacks' the others who must 'die' in exaggerated slow motion ways.

name: Hot Spot
description: One player starts singing a song in the center of the circle. When a player on the outside is reminded of a song, they replace the first player and start their song.

name: Foreign Film Dub
description: Two players act out a scene in a made-up language, while two other players provide English 'subtitles'.

name: Expert Double Figures
description: Two players form a 'figure' with their bodies. A third player is the 'expert' and must describe what the figure represents.

name: Machine
description: One player starts by repeating a simple sound and motion. One by one, other players join with their own, creating an 'improv machine'.

name: Sentences
description: Players pull sentences written by the audience out of a hat and must incorporate them into the scene.

name: Pan Left
description: Four players form a square and start four separate scenes. A director calls 'Pan left' or 'Pan right', rotating the square to change scenes.

name: Space Jump
description: One player starts a scene. Additional players join, each adding a new situation. Once full, players exit in reverse order, resolving each situation.

name: Should've Said
description: Players start a scene. At any point, the director can say 'Should've said,' at which point the last player to speak must change what they said.

name: The Alphabet Game
description: Players perform a scene where each sentence must start with the next letter of the alphabet.

name: Hitchhiker
description: Players are in a car. A 'hitchhiker' enters with a specific characteristic that everyone in the car must adopt.

name: Chain Murder Mystery
description: Players communicate the details of a 'murder' (including location, weapon, and identity) using only mime and gibberish.

name: Eulogy
description: One player leaves the room, then returns as a character who has died. The other players deliver a eulogy, giving the dead character clues to guess their identity, cause of death, and accomplishment.

name: Living Scenery
description: Two players perform a scene, with two additional players acting as any objects or scenery that are interacted with.

name: Clap Freeze
description: Two players start a scene. At any time, an offstage player can clap, freeze the scene, take a player's position, and start a new scene.

name: One Voice Expert
description: Two or more players speak in unison as an 'expert' on a subject suggested by the audience, responding to questions from an interviewer.

name: Late For Work
description: One player is 'late for work' and must guess from their 'boss' and 'coworkers' why they were late, what they did, and what they brought with them.

name: Column Advice
description: Two players perform a scene where they periodically read lines from a 'column' of audience suggestions.

name: The Dating Game
description: One player is a 'bachelor' who asks questions of three 'contestants' with unique quirks. The bachelor must then guess what their quirks are.

name: Moving Bodies
description: Two players act out a scene, but can't move unless moved by audience members.

name: Silent Scene
description: Players perform a scene without speaking, using only physicality and facial expressions to communicate.

name: Half-Life
description: Players perform a one-minute scene, then the same scene in 30 seconds, 15 seconds, and so on, until they're performing it in just one second.

name: Three-Headed Broadway Star
description: Three players improvise a song one word at a time, based on a title suggested by the audience.

name: Two Truths and a Lie
description: Each player tells two truths and a lie about themselves. The other players must guess which statement is the lie.

name: The Question Game
description: Players must have a conversation in which they only speak in questions.

name: Whose Line
description: Players perform a scene while periodically incorporating lines of dialogue written by the audience that they pull from a hat.

name: Emotional Rollercoaster
description: Players perform a scene while a director calls out different emotions that the players must immediately adopt.

name: Oscar Winning Moment
description: Players perform a scene. At any time, the director can call 'Oscar Winning Moment' and the selected player must deliver a dramatic monologue.

name: Instant Replay
description: Players perform a scene. Afterwards, they must perform it again with the exact same dialogue and actions.

name: Genre Replay
description: Players perform a short scene, then perform it again in different genres called out by the director or audience.

name: Gibberish Translation
description: One player speaks in gibberish, another player translates.

name: Crazy Eights
description: Eight players each perform a unique motion and sound, then quickly swap and replicate each other's actions.

name: Song Title
description: Players have a conversation, but can only speak in song titles.

name: Oracle
description: Multiple players speak as one 'oracle', answering audience questions one word at a time.

name: Dr. Know-It-All
description: Multiple players answer audience questions one word at a time, as though they are one expert.

name: Stage Picture
description: Players silently create a scene by forming a 'stage picture' with their bodies. They then step out and describe the scene they formed.

name: Word at a Time Expert
description: Players take turns adding one word at a time to an 'expert' answer to an audience question.

name: Split Scenes
description: Two pairs of players perform separate scenes simultaneously. They must incorporate any overlapping dialogue from the other pair into their own scene.

name: Soundtrack
description: One player provides sound effects or musical accompaniment to a scene.

name: Ding/Buzz
description: Players perform a scene. A 'ding' sound means they must replace the last line of dialogue with something different.

name: Five Things
description: Players must guess 'five things' about a scenario based on pantomimed clues from other players.

name: Puppet Master
description: Players can only move when manipulated by other players who are 'pulling their strings'.

name: Interrogation
description: One player is 'interrogated' and must guess their 'crime' based on the other players' hints.

name: Four Square
description: Four players form a square and perform four different scenes. A clap rotates the square and switches the active scene.

name: Dubbed Movie
description: One group of players act as the characters in a movie speaking in gibberish, another group provides their 'dubbed' dialogue.

name: One Word at a Time
description: Players tell a story one word at a time.

name: The Endowment Game
description: One player leaves the room. The remaining players assign them a character, occupation, or trait which they must guess upon returning.

name: Zoom Schwartz Profigliano
description: A rhythm game where players pass and block 'energy' using the words 'Zoom', 'Schwartz', and 'Profigliano'.

name: Film Critic
description: One player acts as a film critic, describing scenes from a movie that the other players then act out.

name: Panel of Experts
description: Players are experts in bizarre fields, answering questions from the audience.

name: Slide Show
description: One player narrates a slide show (other players forming tableaus) about a given topic.

name: Fishbowl
description: Players draw prompts from a fishbowl and perform quick scenes based on them.

name: Chain Death Murder
description: Players pass a 'murder' down the line using only mime and gibberish, with each player's interpretation building on the last.

name: One Word At a Time Song
description: Players compose a song one word at a time.

name: Tag Out
description: Players perform a scene. At any time, a player off stage can 'tag out' one of them and take their place, continuing the scene with a new twist.

name: Speak in One Voice
description: Two or more players try to speak simultaneously as if they were one person.

name: Question Game
description: Players perform a scene where they can only speak in questions.

name: Pillars
description: Two players perform a scene, using audience members as 'pillars' to provide occasional words they must incorporate.

name: Remote Control
description: Players perform a scene. An offstage player can 'change the channel' at any time, prompting the players to switch genres or styles.

name: Poetry Corner
description: Players create and recite a poem one line at a time.

name: Voices from Heaven
description: One player performs a monologue. Other players provide 'voices from heaven' that only the monologuer can hear and must react to.
